com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.dialogs.handler

Interface ButtonHandler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CanEnable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    HideableButtonHandler, HideableCaptionButtonHandler
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ButtonComposite, ButtonHandlerSwingButtonAdapter, ButtonHandlerSWTButtonAdapter, ButtonHandlerSwtLabelAdapter, ButtonHandlerWindowCloseAdapter, CaptionButtonHandlerSwtLabelAdapter, HideableButtonHandlerAdapter, HideableButtonHandlerSwingButtonAdapter, HideableCaptionButtonHandlerSwingButtonAdapter, MemoryButtonHandler

    public interface ButtonHandler
extends CanEnable
    The interface ButtonHandler is used to access GUI buttons.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addClickHandler(ClickHandler clickHandler)
      All click handlers are executed if the user clicks on the button or if setDefault was called and the Enter key was clicked or if setEscape was called and the Escape key was clicked.
      void setDefault()
      Sets the button as form default button (button click by pressing Enter).
      void setEscape()
      Sets the button as form escape button (button click by pressing Escape).

      • Methods inherited from interface com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.dialogs.handler.CanEnable

        setEnabled

    • Method Detail

      • addClickHandler

        void addClickHandler(ClickHandler clickHandler)
        All click handlers are executed if the user clicks on the button or if setDefault was called and the Enter key was clicked or if setEscape was called and the Escape key was clicked.

      • setDefault

        void setDefault()
        Sets the button as form default button (button click by pressing Enter). If button1.setDefault and later button2.setDefault was called, button2 will be the default. Requirement: The Enter key should only work if the button is enabled.

      • setEscape

        void setEscape()
        Sets the button as form escape button (button click by pressing Escape). You are only allowed to call this method once on each instance of a view, depending on the current implementation in api-gui-swt and api-gui-swing. Otherwise all button-click-handlers of all buttons where setEscape was called will be executed. Another side effect on swt-impl is that Escape does not close the dialog directly. Requirement: The Escape key should only work if the button is enabled.
